info.title: DRES Client API
info.description: Client API for DRES (Distributed Retrieval Evaluation Server), Version 2.0.0

get.summary: Endpoint to accept submissions

parameters.name: collection
parameters.description: Collection identifier. Optional, in which case the default collection for the run will be considered.

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: Identifier for the actual media object or media file.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: Text to be submitted. ONLY for tasks with target type TEXT. If this parameter is provided, it superseeds all athers.

parameters.name: frame
parameters.description: Frame number for media with temporal progression (e.g., video).

parameters.name: shot
parameters.description: Shot number for media with temporal progression (e.g., video).

parameters.name: timecode
parameters.description: Timecode for media with temporal progression (e.g,. video).

get.summary: Returns an overview of the currently active task for a run.
Lists an overview of all evaluation runs visible to the current client.
Lists an overview of all evaluations visible to the current user.
Lists an overview of all evaluation visible to the current user.
Returns the task hint for the specified task.
Returns basic information about a specific evaluation.
Returns the state of a specific evaluation.
Returns all submissions for the current task run, if one is either running or has just ended.
Returns all submissions for the current task that are more recent than the provided timestamp, if a task is either running or has just ended.

parameters.name: timestamp
parameters.description: Timestamp that marks the lower bound for returned submissions.

get.summary: Returns the task target for the current task run (i.e. the one that is currently selected).
Returns the information for the currently active task template (i.e., the one that is currently selected).
Returns the submissions of a specific task run, regardless of whether it is currently running or has ended.

post.summary: Sets roles for session based on user account and returns a session cookie.

get.summary: Clears all user roles of the current session.
Returns a preview video from a media item.

parameters.name: mediaItemId
parameters.description: Unique ID of the media item. Must be a video.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Start timestamp into the video in milliseconds.

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: End timestamp into the video in milliseconds.

get.summary: Returns a preview image from a media item.

parameters.name: mediaItemId
parameters.description: Unique ID of the media item.

parameters.name: timestamp
parameters.description: Time into the video in milliseconds (for videos only).

get.summary: Returns an overview of the server properties.
Returns the current time on the server.

post.summary: Creates a new user, if the username is not already taken. Requires ADMIN privileges

400.description: If the username is already taken

get.summary: Get information about the current user.
Get current sessionId

delete.summary: Deletes the specified user. Requires ADMIN privileges

404.description: If the user could not be found

patch.summary: Updates the specified user, if it exists. Anyone is allowed to update their data, however only ADMINs are allowed to update anyone.

get.summary: Gets details of the user with the given id.

404.description: If the user could not be found.
